solutionsInfographic.main_title: Agro Farm - You know the field. We provide the numbers.

items.name: Soil Sensors
items.description:
• Soil Moisture
• Soil Temperature
• Air Humidity — built-in air sensor
• Electrical Conductivity (EC) — salt level
• Soil pH
• Nitrogen (N) — shows trend, not actual values
• Phosphorus (P) — similar trend
• Potassium (K) — trend

items.name: All this data:
items.description:
• is collected in real-time
• used for AI analytics and recommendations
• helps optimize irrigation, fertilization, treatment, machinery, and yield forecasts

items.name: Plants and Biomass
items.description:
• NDVI / NDRE / SAVI — vegetation indices (via drones or cameras)
• Plant Growth (ultrasonic or optical sensors)
• Trunk Diameter (for trees or grapes)
• Chlorophyll Level
• Leaf Infrared Reflection (stress)
items.label: PLANNING PREPARATION PLANTING

items.name: Other Sensors
items.description:
• Water Level Sensors (in irrigation ditches, tanks, pipes)
• Water Pressure
• Leakage / Flooding
• Light Level in Greenhouses
• Cameras and Motion (for security)

items.name: Atmospheric and Climate Sensors
items.description:
• Air Temperature
• Relative Humidity
• Atmospheric Pressure
• Wind Speed and Direction
• Precipitation Amount
• Solar Radiation
• UV-index
• Evapotranspiration (ET) Level
• Dew Point Temperature
• Plant Leaf Temperature (using an IR thermometer)

infoPanel.title: Region Information
infoPanel.placeholder: Click on a region on the map to see brief information.

KZ10.name: Abai Region
KZ10.description: An eastern region of Kazakhstan, formed in 2022 from a part of the East Kazakhstan Region. Characterized by diverse climate and landscape, favorable for the development of grain farming, livestock breeding, and mineral extraction.

KZ11.name: Akmola Region
KZ11.description: A central region of Kazakhstan, where the capital Astana is located. Known as the main grain-producing center of the country with developed livestock breeding.

KZ12.name: Aktobe Region
KZ12.description: A western region of Kazakhstan, bordering Russia and Uzbekistan. It has vast steppes and semi-deserts, developed livestock breeding, and significant oil and gas reserves.

KZ13.name: Almaty Region
KZ13.description: A southeastern region of Kazakhstan, characterized by a diverse climate – from deserts to high-mountain areas. It is an agrarian center with developed horticulture, vegetable growing, and grain crops.

KZ14.name: Atyrau Region
KZ14.description: A western region of Kazakhstan, located in the Caspian lowland. The main wealth of the region is oil and gas, agriculture specializes in livestock breeding in arid conditions.

KZ15.name: East Kazakhstan Region
KZ15.description: An eastern region of Kazakhstan with mountainous terrain and rich water resources. Characterized by developed grain farming, livestock breeding, and beekeeping.

KZ16.name: Jambyl Region
KZ16.description: A southern region of Kazakhstan with a diverse climate, from semi-deserts to the foothills of the Tian Shan. A large agricultural region with developed vegetable growing, horticulture, and livestock breeding.

KZ17.name: West Kazakhstan Region
KZ17.description: A western region of Kazakhstan, located on the border with Russia. Characterized by vast steppes and significant hydrocarbon reserves. Agriculture is focused on livestock breeding.

KZ18.name: Karaganda Region
KZ18.description: The largest region by area in Kazakhstan, located in the center of the country. An important industrial center with developed coal mining and metallurgy, as well as significant agricultural production.

KZ19.name: Kostanay Region
KZ19.description: A northwestern region of Kazakhstan, one of the leading grain-producing regions of the country. It has fertile soils and a favorable climate for growing grains.

KZ20.name: Kyzylorda Region
KZ20.description: A southern region of Kazakhstan, located in the Syr Darya river delta. Known as the main rice-producing region of the country, as well as developed livestock breeding.

KZ21.name: Mangystau Region
KZ21.description: A southwestern region of Kazakhstan, located on the coast of the Caspian Sea. Characterized by a desert climate and is a major center for oil and gas production. Agriculture is severely limited, but camel breeding and sheep breeding are developed.

KZ22.name: Pavlodar Region
KZ22.description: A northeastern region of Kazakhstan, located along the Irtysh River. A large industrial and agricultural center with developed grain farming, potato growing, and livestock breeding.

KZ23.name: North Kazakhstan Region
KZ23.description: The northernmost region of Kazakhstan, bordering Russia. The main grain-producing region of the country with fertile chernozems and high agricultural potential.

KZ24.name: Turkistan Region
KZ24.description: One of the most densely populated and agriculturally developed regions in southern Kazakhstan. The favorable climate contributes to the cultivation of a wide range of agricultural crops.

KZ25.name: Ulytau Region
KZ25.description: A new region formed in 2022 from a part of the Karaganda Region. Located in the central part of Kazakhstan. Characterized by significant potential in livestock breeding, as well as the presence of minerals.

KZ26.name: Zhetysu Region
KZ26.description: A new region formed in 2022 from a part of the Almaty Region. Located in southeastern Kazakhstan, it has a diverse climate and fertile lands. It is an important agricultural region with developed horticulture, vegetable growing, and grains.

KZ71.name: Astana (city)
KZ71.description: The capital of Kazakhstan, located in the Akmola Region. Agriculture is mainly represented by suburban production of vegetables and dairy products to supply the urban population.
plants: Vegetables (in greenhouse complexes and suburban farms)

KZ75.name: Almaty (city)
KZ75.description: The largest city in Kazakhstan, located at the foothills of the Trans-Ili Alatau mountains. Agriculture is represented by intensive horticulture, vegetable growing, and floriculture in the suburbs, as well as the processing industry.

KZ79.name: Shymkent (city)
KZ79.description: One of the largest cities in Kazakhstan, located in the south of the country. It is an important agricultural and industrial center, surrounded by fertile lands where melons, cotton, and vegetables are grown.

KZ-ARA.name: Aral Region
KZ-ARA.description: A region located around the Aral Sea, characterized by complex environmental conditions and the development of specific types of agriculture.
